talks.title: Escape from Planet Regex - Kotlin to the Rescue
talks.description: An exciting adventure into the mysterious world of Regex and Kotlin together! Come aboard the SS Singleton & journey with me to Planet Regex, where you will learn all about the Basics (and some advanced bit) of Regex & then more importantly how to use that knowledge in your favourite programming language; Kotlin!

talks.title: Practical ADB usage to enhance your life!
talks.description: A talk showcasing some actually useful ways to integrate and use ADB in your android development workflow to make your life better and easier, including lots of cool lesser known ways to use ADB like automatic input, properly debugging your app and seeing and editing your apps internal storage

talks.title: Inside the .git folder - Explore the mysterious depths...
talks.description: Conference talk - Fun & Entertaining presentation that takes the audience on a cave diving expedition into the cave system of the .git folder and explains each file and folder in there which in turn highlights how git works internally with a mysterious & fun twist!

talks.title: Beginner Stand Up Comedy Course - 5 Minute Standup Set

talks.title: Git workshop with Ben Kadel - TechNomads (Part 2)
talks.description: In this interactive tutorial session I teach a group called 'The Tech Nomads' about git. Starting from 0 and going all the way through to enable them to create their first PR and contribution to a codebase, whilst explaining everything in a thorugh but easy to digest way

talks.title: Git workshop with Ben Kadel - TechNomads (Part 1)
talks.description: In this interactive tutorial session I teach a group called 'The Tech Nomads' about git. Starting from 0 and going all the way through to enable them to create their first PR and contribution to a codebase, whilst explaining everything in a thorugh but easy to digest way

talks.title: Android interview with, Benjamin Kadel
talks.description: A wonderful YouTuber called Mohsen (Channel: Android Developer Tips) asked if he could interview me about my job as a Senior Android developer and all the things that come along with the work and lifestyle to help new potential developers understand the industry and what we do in it

talks.title: The journey of adopting Jetpack Compose in Babbel’s App
talks.description: In this session, we will be sharing Our journey of adopting Compose into the Babbel App, the lessons learned, the ups and downs, the decisions we made and why we made them, and how to replicate that in your app. Basically, all and every takeaway from our journey starting from adopting the compose mindset all the way to how we integrated it with the already existing app architecture, design system and see what differences Compose has made to the Babbel app.

talks.title: Scouts - Learn to code with Scratch - CONTINUED
talks.description: This was the continuation of the previous scouts session and was basically a session for the scouts to present their creations back to me and get feedback on them

talks.title: Scouts - Learn to code with Scratch
talks.description: Presenting to a group of about 20 scout children about how to code. From the basics of a computer and binary to using the program called scratch to create things. This was a fun fast paced interacive tutorial

talks.title: InnovateHer - My Experiences as a Lead Mentor
talks.description: Telling an audience of potential ambassadors for a new InnovateHer program about my experiences on a previous prorgam. I shared my feels on the amazing programme and shared some stoies from the incredible girls and what they created during the course

talks.title: Personal Brand (Webinar) Podcast - Why it matters
talks.description: Myself and Andy talked with Parul (Manhattan Partners) for a podcast episode, we discussed personal branding, our stories within that context and tips for folks looking to start their personal branding journey

talks.title: A Gift for Git-mas
talks.description: A git gift containing a couple of tasty nuggets of git knowledge for you indulge on this holiday season... Git config, git stash and git undo (15 minutes)

talks.title: Introduction to Tech, The Very Group and life as a dev
talks.description: Talk about the range of roles in the tech industry, abit about the very group and told the audience about my journey into tech and what a day in the life looks like for me. I also gave them a few tips and hints to help them in the future

talks.title: Diversity in tech
talks.description: Talk about the range of roles in the tech industry, lots of different types of jobs and how we need representation from everyone in order to truly innovate for EVERYONE

talks.title: Advanced Git Tutorial Session
talks.description: Second interactive git session where I teach with a hands-on, interactive approach git. In particular stepping up to some of the more complicated topics

talks.title: How to create your own brand
talks.description: Myself and Andy talked to the students about how to create your own brand, why its important and some tips to help others begin building

talks.title: Who we are and my journey
talks.description: TVG: Who we are, what we do, my job and journey, tech at the very group and how to get a job here

talks.title: Who we are, my journey & getting into The Very Group
talks.description: TVG: Who we are, what we do, life the very group, our values and culture and how to get a job here

talks.title: Introduction to the Very Android App
talks.description: Giving a high level but informative overview of our Android application for Very and Littlewoods, who makes it, what goes into making it and how we deliver it

talks.title: Mobile App Team Hackathon
Beginner Git Tutorial Session
talks.description: A beginner level, interactive git session where I teach with a hands-on approach git. In particular the real basic and explain the concept of VCS

talks.title: Code & Create with Orbis: Introduction to Kotlin for Java developers
talks.description: A clear introduction to the Kotlin language, especially for Java developers that are migrating over to it or thinking of doing so. A presenter (Joe Davies) asking questions in order to tee up segments of presentation

talks.title: Beginner Terminal Workshop - How to use the Bash Terminal
talks.description: An interactive workshop showing the audience how to use the Linux/Unix Terminal (with a Bash Shell) with a hands-on approach. From the ground up entirely beginner commands and explanations

talks.title: Beginner Terminal Workshop - How to use the Bash Terminal
talks.description: An interactive workshop showing the audience how to use the Linux/Unix Terminal (with a Bash Shell) with a hands-on approach. From the ground up entirely beginner commands and explanations

talks.title: How to contribute to Open Source Software
talks.description: An interactive workshop showing the audience how to get involved with open source. The audience used git commands and github to contribute to a demo codebase and I explained the power of Open Source

talks.title: BBC Bitesize QA Panel
talks.description: On stage for several hour long sessions to see all students in the high school and be on a panel of 3 industry experts (including myself) and being asked about our jobs and paths by a radio one presenter

talks.title: Bring industry to life - Year 13s
talks.description: A brief introduction to myself, our values at The Very Group and Tech within the company to Year 13 students from a nearby school

talks.title: Innovate Her Mentoring
talks.description: Lead mentoring and teaching a 8 session introduction to tech, the industry and programming for a group of female high school students as part of the Innovate Her program to get more woman into the tech industry
talks.extra: I think photos and tweets on twitter (Every Wednesday after work from 25.09.2019 - 20.11.2019 [9 total])

talks.title: BBC Bitesize QA Panel
talks.description: On stage for several hour long sessions to see all students in the high school and be on a panel of 3 industry experts (including myself) and being asked about our jobs and paths by a radio one presenter

talks.title: Intro to The Very Group, my journey and advice on how to get ahead now
talks.description: Introduction to the Very Group in general, introduction into myself and how I got into tech and my journey. Tips and Advice on things the students can do now to get ahead and start preparing for the workplace

talks.title: Q & A Panel - Employers in the North West
Hosting Tech Showcase
talks.description: The Tech Showcase was large event that we arranged and hosted for colleagues to showcase some of the cool tech people are using and learning about in order to teach others. This is where the Tech Forum boys surprised me by playing my blooper reel from YT

talks.title: Doris IT - Podcast Episode: We don't ask for permission, we ask for forgiveness
talks.description: Talked about the Very group briefly and life in a developer technological role and having different platforms like Twitter and YouTube and how it is important to ask for forgiveness and not permission

talks.title: Agent Academy - Introduction to Tech at the Very Group
talks.description: Talked to the students about my role and the very group in general

talks.title: Beginner Git Session (Git for dummies)
talks.description: A beginner level, interactive git session where I teach with a hands-on approach git. In particular the real basic and explain the concept of VCS

talks.title: Introduce the new Interns
talks.description: A gentle introduction session to the new group of Interns on their first day, tell them about Very group, my role, the workplace, our values and play some ice breaker games with them to put them at ease

talks.title: The App Team Operations Monitor - ATOM (Tech Forum)
talks.description: Gave a presentation at the Tech forum about the software that I created called ATOM (App Team Operations Monitor) that the app team use to display status' and stats about their builds, tests and deployments

talks.title: Intro to The Very Group, my journey and advice on how to get ahead now
talks.description: Introduction to the Very Group in general, introduction into myself and how I got into tech and my journey. Tips and Advice on things the students can do now to get ahead and start preparing for the workplace

talks.title: Beginner Git Session (Git for dummies) [First Time]
talks.description: A beginner level, interactive git session where I teach with a hands-on approach git. In particular the real basic and explain the concept of VCS

talks.title: My Life in the Terminal
talks.description: A talk (actually in the Terminal) about my tools and workflow inside the Terminal and some of the awesome tools I use to enhance my dev experience

talks.title: Networking with students at Sensor City
talks.description: Meet and greet with many of the Comp Sci students to tell them about TVG. Also to identify who would make a good placement student for the company, beer and pizza

talks.title: 12 Session Java course to High School Students (Y7 - Y11)
talks.extra: Every Wednesday after work from 13.02.2019 planned for 12 sessions [10 actually]

talks.title: Chester Devs: Git Power Commands
talks.description: Presenting at Chester Devs a public developer meetup. I talked about a set of powerful lesser known git power commands!

talks.title: Wild west of Object Oriented Programming (Java)
talks.description: A presentation and interactive tutorial to learn about the basics of object oriented programming in the Java programming language

talks.title: My experience as a career coach and tech coach
talks.description: I discussed and presented my findings and experiences of being a career coach and a tech coach for the degree apprentices, so that the new starting coaches could understand what their role and tasks would be

talks.title: Build My Future - The State of the Industry
talks.description: Talked about the state of the tech industry, what the students can expect from it, some of the trends at the time and some of the useful programming languages to know

talks.title: BIMA - How the Internet works
talks.description: Talked about how the internet actually works using props and audience volunteers to help demonstrate it to the high school students. Explaining everything from IP addresses to DNS servers, before judging the students BIMA competition

talks.title: BIMA - How the Internet works
talks.description: Talked about how the internet actually works using props and audience volunteers to help demonstrate it to the high school students. Explaining everything from IP addresses to DNS servers, before judging the students BIMA competition
talks.extra: Also have these slides for some reason: SMALL_0909-LU-FirstYears.pptx

talks.title: Tech Showcase (2) - Quick Git Commands
talks.description: Took the audience through a tailored collection of lesser known git commands and explained what each did
talks.extra: Also have these slides for some reason: GitCommandsQuickNEW.pptx

talks.title: STEM Fair at Liverpool Uni (The Crypt)
talks.description: Held and ran a stand at the job fair to meet and engage with students about The Very Group (SD at the time) and also gave them a coding challenge to try and solve [Recruitment]

talks.title: Career Coach Induction
talks.description: Talked to colleagues that were becoming career coaches about what the role entails and my experiences with it

talks.title: Understanding the technical role for apprenticeships
talks.description: Talked to colleagues that were becoming tech coaches about what the role entails and my experiences with it

talks.title: Visited the Studio
talks.description: Was not to present, instead it was an event to visit the school, see some of the students work and code and engage with them about TVG

talks.title: Git and Github Interactive Tutorial
talks.description: Taught a interactive tutorial lecture to an array of Comp Sci students at LU about what Git is, how it is different to Github and how to use them both correctly
talks.extra: Files also contained in /videosForGitTalk and help sheet is: gitHelpSheet

talks.title: Apprentice Assessment Day - What is Software Engineering
talks.description: Described coding, my job and the industry to the potential candidates. I also told them a little bit about the company and what we do before being part of the team that observed and judged the candidates to decide who would proceed to the next steps

talks.title: Firebase findings playback
talks.description: After a short amount of research time I fed back to my immediate team the things I discovered about firebase and the capabilities it could give us

talks.title: Java Tuesdays with Ben Kadel
talks.description: Every week on a Tuesday I would spend just over an hour teaching the degree apprentices the Java programming language with 1-2-1 help on their uni lectures and labs

talks.title: Be your own boss Q&A panel
talks.description: Was part of a Q&A panel (with 2 other externals from other companies) at LU where we described our roles at our companies and answers student asked questions

talks.title: Intern Assessment Day
talks.description: Not to present but to be part of the intern assessment day to observe and judge potential interns and helping to decide which should progress to the next step

talks.title: How to get a job in the Tech Industry
talks.description: Myself and Andy split the session, he took the first half talking about how to market yourself to employers and I took the second half talking about tips the students can use now to enhance their chances later

talks.title: Wild west of Object Oriented Programming (Java)
talks.description: A presentation and interactive tutorial to learn about the basics of object oriented programming in the Java programming language

talks.title: Introduction to Git and Github (GIT COP)
talks.description: The first time the Git tutorial presentation was given to selection of colleagues at SD that signed up for the workshop, was a full introduction to git in the terminal and github [lots fo tech problems remember]
